qas.question: Stimulating nociceptors will induce which type of pain?

answers.text: according to the mode of noxious stimulation

qas.question: The thermal category of pain deals with which two temperature ranges?
Crushing, tearing and shearing are examples of which type of pain?
What is the term for nociceptors which respond to more than one type of stimuli?
What type of pain is caused by stimulation of fiber?

plausible_answers.text: "thermal" (e.g. heat or cold), "mechanical" (e.g. crushing, tearing, shearing, etc.) and "chemical"

qas.question: What are the common categories of modalities pain?
What does mechanical pain refer to along with cold?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Nociceptive<a0_0/> pain<b5_0/> is caused by stimulation of peripheral nerve fibers that respond to stimuli approaching or exceeding harmful intensity (nociceptors), and may be classified <a1_0>according to the mode of noxious stimulation<a1_0/>. The most common categories are <b6_0>"thermal" (e.g. <a2_0><b7_0>heat<b7_0/> or cold<a2_0/>), "<a3_0>mechanical<a3_0/>" (e.g. crushing, tearing, shearing, etc.) and "chemical"<b6_0/> (e.g. iodine in a cut or chemicals released during inflammation). Some nociceptors respond to more than one of these modalities and are consequently designated <a4_0>polymodal<a4_0/>.
